meta.name: Scrape Event Data from 10times with Bright Data MCP, AI & Google Sheets

parameters.text:
=Scrape all category, featured_event, attendee_feedback and venue data using "MCP Client to Scrape as markdown" tool:
url: {{ $json.url }}

parameters.toolDescription: Scrape a single webpage URL with advanced options for content extraction and get back the results in markdown

parameters.content:
## üü¢ **SECTION 1: Trigger & Input Configuration**

### üîÅ `üïí Schedule Scraper`

This is the **starting point** of the workflow. You can set it to run:

* At specific intervals (e.g., daily, weekly)
* Or manually (while testing)

> üìò *Benefit for beginners:* No coding needed! Just drag and set the schedule, and your workflow runs itself.

---

### ‚úèÔ∏è `‚öôÔ∏è Input URL & Params`

Here, you provide the **URL of the 10times event page** (like: `https://10times.com/ces/exhibitors`). You can customize or hardcode this value.

> üìò *Tip:* You can turn this into a form or connect it to a database to auto-feed event URLs.

---

## ü§ñ **SECTION 2: Smart Scraping via AI Agent**

This is where the **heavy lifting** happens using Bright Data‚Äôs **Mobile Carrier Proxy (MCP)** and OpenAI‚Äôs logic to bypass website protections.

---

### üß† `ü§ñ Bright Data AI Agent`

This node coordinates scraping. It tells the agent exactly:

* Which URL to open
* What to extract (like attendees, venues, events)
* How to format the response (in markdown or JSON)

> ‚ö° *Why it's powerful:* The AI Agent understands human-like prompts and adapts scraping automatically.

---

#### üß† `üß† Agent Memory Model`

Helps the Agent remember its instructions or carry session context (e.g., "continue scrolling", "grab the next batch").

---

#### üåê `üï∑Ô∏è MCP Scraper: 10times`

This is the **actual web scraper** running on **Bright Data‚Äôs mobile proxy** ‚Äî which mimics a real mobile device to avoid bot detection. It loads JavaScript, scrolls pages, and handles dynamic content.

> üõ°Ô∏è *Biggest Advantage:* Can access pages that block most traditional scrapers!

---

#### üìÑ `üßæ Parse Attendee Data`

Uses the **Structured Output Parser** to turn messy scraped markdown into clean, structured JSON with fields like:

* `categories`
* `featured_events`
* `attendee_feedback`
* `venues`

> üß© *Tip:* This is the secret to clean automation ‚Äî parsed data can now be reused, filtered, or enriched!

---

## üìä **SECTION 3: Save & Reuse the Leads**

### üì• `üì• Save to Google Sheets`

This node stores each piece of parsed data (e.g., 1 attendee feedback per row) into your connected **Google Sheets** document.

* Each row is tagged with a `type` (like `category`, `venue`, etc.)
* You can filter, analyze, or export this for marketing, research, outreach, etc.

> üíº *Business Use:* Build a database of trending events, track where competitors exhibit, or generate cold outreach leads.

---

## üöÄ **Workflow Title: 10times Event Intelligence Scraper**

> This no-code automation scrapes attendee data from [10times.com](https://10times.com), parses it into structured information (like categories, events, and feedback), and logs it into Google Sheets for lead generation or event research.

---

### üîÅ `üïí Schedule Scraper`

This is the **starting point** of the workflow. You can set it to run:

* At specific intervals (e.g., daily, weekly)
* Or manually (while testing)

> üìò *Benefit for beginners:* No coding needed! Just drag and set the schedule, and your workflow runs itself.

### ‚úèÔ∏è `‚öôÔ∏è Input URL & Params`

Here, you provide the **URL of the 10times event page** (like: `https://10times.com/ces/exhibitors`). You can customize or hardcode this value.

> ‚ö° *Why it's powerful:* The AI Agent understands human-like prompts and adapts scraping automatically.

Helps the Agent remember its instructions or carry session context (e.g., "continue scrolling", "grab the next batch").

#### üåê `üï∑Ô∏è MCP Scraper: 10times`

This is the **actual web scraper** running on **Bright Data‚Äôs mobile proxy** ‚Äî which mimics a real mobile device to avoid bot detection. It loads JavaScript, scrolls pages, and handles dynamic content.

> üõ°Ô∏è *Biggest Advantage:* Can access pages that block most traditional scrapers!

#### üìÑ `üßæ Parse Attendee Data`

Uses the **Structured Output Parser** to turn messy scraped markdown into clean, structured JSON with fields like:

## üìä **SECTION 3: Save & Reuse the Leads**

### üì• `üì• Save to Google Sheets`

This node stores each piece of parsed data (e.g., 1 attendee feedback per row) into your connected **Google Sheets** document.

* Each row is tagged with a `type` (like `category`, `venue`, etc.)
* You can filter, analyze, or export this for marketing, research, outreach, etc.

## ‚úÖ Summary for Beginners

| üß© Feature      | üí° Purpose                                                 | üë∂ Beginner Tip                                    |
| --------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------- |
| Trigger & Input | Decide **when and what** to scrape                         | No code needed ‚Äî just set your event URL           |
| AI Agent & MCP  | Use **AI-powered scraper** to get around anti-bot barriers | Agent uses natural language, no selector headaches |
| Parser          | Clean your data into usable format                         | Plug-and-play output with titles, dates, users     |
